thread.title: Wife of ex-Florida cop in movie theater slay testifies in hearing
thread.title_full: Wife of ex-Florida cop in movie theater slay testifies in hearing

author: DAVID BOROFF
title: Wife of ex-Florida cop in movie theater slay testifies in hearing
text:
NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   10:01 AM 
The wife of a former police captain accused of killing a man who was texting in a Florida movie theater testified Wednesday that the shooting victim was cursing and seemed to be "coming over." 
Pinellas-Pasco Circuit Judge Susan Barthle is hearing evidence to determine whether Curtis Reeves, 71 at the time, acted in self-defense when he shot 43-year-old Chad Oulson during a screening of "Lone Survivor" in Wesley Chapel in 2014. Reeves is facing a second-degree murder charge. 
She is being asked to decide whether Curtis Reeves should be immune from prosecution under Florida's controversial Stand Your Ground statute. 
Cops say Oulson threw popcorn at Reeves before the former Tampa officer shot him. 
Stand Your Ground hearing underway in Florida movie theater slay 
Vivian Reeves recalled in a Dade City courtroom that Oulson used the word "f---" or "f " when her husband tried to get him to stop texting, according to ABC News . It was at that point when Curtis Reeves went to tell the manager. 
"It scared me," she said of that first exchange, according to ABC News. "I was horrified that somebody would act like that, especially in a movie theater." Vivian Reeves testifies during Stand Your Ground hearing in Florida on Wednesday. (WFLA) 
When the former police officer returned to the theater, Oulson yelled at him, according to Vivian Reeves. 
"You told on me," she recalled Oulson as saying, according to ABC News. "Who the f--- do you think you are?" 
Retired Fla. police captain charged with fatal movie theater shooting released on bail 
She said in court that "it happened very quickly, and his whole upper body just came forward, and I thought that he was coming over," according to ABC News. 
Vivian Reeves testified that she heard shots. She said her husband told her, "he hit me in the face," ABC News reported. 
"I just didn't know what happened," she said in court, according to the network. Chad Oulson was fatally shot during an altercation in a Florida movie theater in 2014. His wife Nicole was shot in the hand. (Facebook) 
She said that an off-duty deputy relieved her husband of his gun. 
"I said something to Curtis," Vivian Reeves testified, according to ABC News . "I said, 'What happened?' You canâ€™t shoot into a theater full of people.' He said, 'Not now.'" 
During her testimony, Vivian Reeves recalled that she has never been "so scared in my life" that day, according to Fox 13 . 
When she was cross-examined, she was asked if she walked past a sign that said guns or knives were not allowed in the theater, according to the Tampa Bay Times . When she was asked if she told her husband about the sign, she said no, the newspaper reported. 
She was also asked if the "no cellphones" announcement before the previews was of more significance than the sign that banned guns. Curtis Reeves (right) sits with his defense attorney Richard Escobar in court on Tuesday. (Charlie Kaijo/AP) 
"I think it depends on the person," she said, according to the Tampa Bay Times. 
Chad Oulson's wife Nicole, who was shot in the hand, told the network in 2014 that her her husband was using the phone to text their babysitter. 
"It was a couple of words," she told ABC News at the time. "No threats. No harm. No nothing. In the blink of an eye, 30 seconds, it just shattered my world." 
The hearing resumed Thursday morning. On Friday, the court will take a trip to the theater to examine where the shooting took place, according to WFLA .
